shortdesc.ph: Sets the raw audio playback data format before mixing.
Sets the raw audio playback data format before mixing.
Sets the format of the raw audio playback data before mixing.
Sets the raw audio playback data format before mixing.

p.codeblock: public abstract int SetPlaybackAudioFrameBeforeMixingParameters(int sampleRate, int channel, int samplesPerCall);

section.p: The SDK triggers the callback based on this sampling interval.
The SDK triggers the callback based on this sampling interval.
The SDK triggers the callback based on the sampling interval.
The SDK triggers the callback based on this sampling interval.

section.title: Timing
section.p: This method must be called before joining a channel.
This method must be called before joining a channel.
You must call this method before joining a channel.
You need to call this method before joining a channel.

plentry.pd: Sampling rate (Hz) of the audio data. Can be set to 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, or 48000.

Number of audio channels. Can be set to 1 or 2:
1: Mono.
2: Stereo.
Sets the number of samples in the audio data returned in the callback. In RTMP streaming scenarios, it is recommended to set this to 1024.
The sample rate (Hz) of the audio data, can be set to 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, or 48000.

The number of audio channels, can be set to 1 or 2:
1: Mono.
2: Stereo.
Sets the number of audio samples returned in the callback. In RTMP streaming scenarios, it is recommended to set this to 1024.
The sample rate (Hz) of the audio data. You can set it to 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, or 48000.

The number of audio channels. You can set it to 1 or 2:
1: Mono.
2: Stereo.
Sets the number of audio samples returned in the callback. In RTMP streaming scenarios, it is recommended to set this to 1024.
The sampling rate (Hz) of the audio data. Can be set to 8000, 16000, 32000, 44100, or 48000.

The number of channels of the audio data. Can be set to 1 or 2:
1: Mono.
2: Stereo.
Sets the number of audio samples returned in the onPlaybackAudioFrameBeforeMixing callback. In RTMP streaming scenarios, it is recommended to set this to 1024.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: This method returns no value if the call succeeds. If the method call fails, it throws an , which you need to catch and handle. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and troubleshooting suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and suggested solutions.
